results.title: Akira Kurosawa's Dreams = Dreams
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Akira Kurosawa USA Productions, Hisao Kurosawa, Mike Y Inoue, Steven Spielberg and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: This Japanese-American co-production can be regarded as Kurosawa’s last personal philosophic and cinematic testament as he explores in eight vignettes the cost of war, the perils of nuclear warfare, and above all man’s need to harmonise with nature. It is Kurosawa’s belief that, ‘Man is genius when he dreams’, and his visions are here, superbly realised in Takao Sato and Masaharu Ueda’s sunny cinematography. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast includes Martin Scorsese and Akire Terao.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista International, Armyan Bernstein, Gail Katz, Jonathan Shestack and Wolfgang Petersen
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.

results.title: Aimee & Jaguar = Aimee and Jaguar
results.creator_credit: Senator Film Production, Hanno Huth, Gunter Rohrbach and Max Farberbock
results.brief_description: Based on the memoirs of Lilly Wust as recorded by Erica Fischer in her best-selling book, published in 1994, “Aimee and Jaguar” is a compelling love story that transgresses socially and politically imposed regulations around gender, race and culture. It tells the true story of two German women, one Jewish and one Aryan, who dared to fall deeply in love with each other at the height of the Holocaust. 1943- Lilly is a model bourgeois German mother of four children who indulges in affairs while husband is away fighting on the Eastern front. When she receives a love letter signed ‘Jaguar,’ she suspects a male admirer. But it is from the audacious Felice, a Jewish Resistance fighter, who initiates the passionate love affair that ignites between the two women amidst the bombing raids and anti-Semitic persecution. Inevitably it is a romance that is destined to end in tragedy. An immensely moving period drama, that also offers a visually impressive evocation of life in Berlin during WWII. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog Filmproduktion and Werner Herzog
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Affliction
results.creator_credit: Largo Entertainment, Reisman, Kingsgate Prod, Linda Reisman and Paul Schrader
results.brief_description: A dark exploration of working-class family relationships, “Affliction” stars Nick Nolte as Wade Whitehouse, a divorced New Hampshire sherif who is dealing with a spoilt petulant daughter, a furious ex-wife, and a increasingly hostile alcoholic father (James Coburn). When a hunting accident occurs in his township, Wade suspects murder and sees an opportunity to make a hero of himself and finally receive the respect of both his daughter and his father. But as the investigation becomes murkier and Wade finds powerful forces aligned against him, he begins to spiral out of control and to give into the violence and alcohol abuse that is his family legacy. Paul Schrader’s thriller, like his entire oeuvre, is as much a study in repression and masculine resentment as it is a conventional murder mystery. Wade is a classic archetype of a fool, a man who always wishes to do good, but whose abuse as a child has led him to distrust women, himself, and to react with violence and anger whenever his authority is challenged. The bleakness of Wade’s life is rooted in the history of his parent’s relationship and even the counseling of his sympathetic girlfriend (Sissy Spacek), and his estranged brother (Willem Dafoe) cannot offer him any hope. James Coburn won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor for his role in this film and the entire cast is informally excellent. Based on the novel by Russell Banks.

results.title: Affair in Trinidad
results.brief_description: An American woman working as a dancer in Trinidad with her artist husband (Neil Emery), is gradually drawn into a web of secret police deals and espionage when her husband is found dead, believed murdered. She, the only ‘key’, is used to obtain evidence against his murderers. His brother arrives to be confronted by his brother’s death. Suspicious, he seeks to find out the truth, falling in love with his dead brother’s wife on the way. Cast includes Rita Hayworth, Glenn Ford, Alexander Scourby and Valerie Bettis (who was also responsible for choreographing Rita Hayworth’s dance sequences). Costume designer Jean Louis was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Costume.

results.title: Adam's rib
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence Weingarten and George Cukor
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn plays Amanda Bonner, the defence attorney in the trial of Doris Attinger for the attempted murder of her husband whom she discovers has a mistress. Spencer Tracy is Amanda’s husband, Adam, prosecuting attorney in the same trial. As the trial progresses, Amanda and Adam find they cannot confine their battle to the courtroom, as the issues of sexual equality extend into their home. Also starring Judy Holliday and Tom Ewell.

results.title: Across the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, First National Pictures, Jerry Wald, Jack Saper and John Huston
results.brief_description: Adapted from the ‘Saturday Evening Post’ serial of the same name name by Robert Carson, this taut World War II thriller reunites the stars of John Huston’s earlier hit,’ The Maltese Falcon’. Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Leland, a tough, cynical Army officer given a bogus dishonorable discharge and sent undercover to hook up with Japanese sympathisers on the eve of Pearl Harbour. Aboard a freighter bound for the Orient, he plays a ticklish game of matching wits with the enigmatic Dr. Lorenz (Sidney Greenstreet), spiced by the presence of the mysterious and beautiful Alberta Marlow (Mary Astor). Huston made this film the year after making his directorial debut with ‘The Maltese Falcon’, and like that classic, this film is full of cool and subtle characters, sharp dialogue, and a plot chock full of twists and turns.

results.title: Ace Ventura: when nature calls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, James G. Robinson and Steve Oedekerk
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey again stars as Ace Ventura, the animal sleuth with the gravity-defying hairstyle in this sequel to ‘Ace Ventura, Pet Detective’ (309280). In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless their sacred animal god is found. So they’re sending for the only man who can help. Africa will never be the same again as Ace discovers the animal within and answers the call of the wild in this out-there comedy! Cast includes Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and Maynard Eziashi.
